Contracts¶

The web app runs on Flask and a PostgreSQL database, synced up with DocumentCloud.

The web app that runs at vault.thelensnola.org/contracts.

It lets the public search City of New Orleans contracts that are posted to the city’s purchasing portal. It’s just a Flask application, and it follows the structure from the Flask tutorials. The front end is built with Foundation. It uses SQLAlchemy to connect to a PostgreSQL database.

class contracts.db.Contract(ponumber=None, contractnumber=None, vendor_id=None, department_id=None, dcid=None, descript=None, name=None, added=None)¶

A contract is any piece of paper that gets posted on the city’s public purchasing portal. Sometimes the city posts “contracts” that are really film permits or MOUs. The doc_cloud_id links the contract to DocumentCloud. The URL for the contract on DocumentCloud will be https://www.documentcloud.org/documents/{{doc_cloud_id}}}.html

The city uses two ID numbers to track contracts: k numbers and PO numbers.

To buy anything, the city must go through an internal approval process that generates a purchase order. This purchase order number gets associated with the final contract.

Each contract that goes to the law department also gets assigned a k number. But some contracts are rejected by the law department and are resubmitted. If this happens, the k number is retired. So there will be gaps in the k numbers.

Parameters:
  • id (int) – The table’s primary key.
  • departmentid (int) – ???, foreign key points to departments.id.
  • vendorid (int) – ???, foreign key points to vendors.id.
  • contractnumber (string) –

    ???

  • purchaseordernumber (string) –

    ???

  • doc_cloud_id (string) –

    ???

  • description (string) –

    ???

  • title (string) –

    ???

  • dateadded (date) –

    ???

get_admin_home()¶

This is a page that shows a contract. If this contract has been parsed then the tags will be on s3. If the contract has not been parsed then there will be no prefilled tags visible

Parameters:doc_cloud_id (string) – The single contract’s uniquey DocumentCloud ID.
Returns:dict. A dict with the updated date.
get_contracts(offset=0, limit=None)¶

Query the database in reverse chronological order. Specify the number of recent contracts with offset and limit values.

Parameters:
  • offset (int) – The number of pages to offset database query.
  • limit (int) – The number of records to return.
Returns:

list. (?) The contracts that matched the query.

Query the count of all contracts in database.

Returns:int. The total number of contracts in the database.

Gets the data necessary for the search page (/contracts/search/).

Parameters:request (dict) – The search parameters supplied by the user.
Returns:dict. Two dicts: one for newly gather data, and the other an altered version of the incoming search parameters.

static parse_query_string(request)¶

Receives URL query string parameters and returns as dict.

Parameters:request (dict?) – A (Flask object?) containing query string.
Returns:dict. The query string parameters entered by the user.
query_document_cloud(search_term, page=1)¶

Queries the DocumentCloud API. This is it’s own method so that queries can be cached via @memoize to speed things up.

Parameters:
  • search_term (string) – The query term to run against DocumentCloud API.
  • page (string) – The page to receive in return. Useful for pagination. Default: 1.
Returns:

dict. (?) The output that matches the query.
query_document_cloud_count(search_term)¶

Finds the number of documents in DocumentCloud project that match this query.

Parameters:search_term (string) – The search term for DocumentCloud API query.
Returns:int. The number of records that match this query.
static translate_to_doc_cloud_form(documents)¶

In the database each row for contracts has an ID which is different from the doc_cloud_id on DocumentCloud. This just translates rows so that their ID is equal to the doc_cloud_id. It’s a bit awkward and should probably be refactored away at some point.

Parameters:documents (list) – A list of documents (from where?).
Returns:list. A list of documents, with corrected IDs (how?).
translate_to_vendor(officer_term)¶

Translates a request for an officer to a request for a vendor associated with a given officer.

Parameters:officer_term (string) – The name of the officer.
Returns:???
translate_web_query_to_dc_query(data)¶

Translates search input parameters into a request string for the DocumentCloud API, which utilizes the Apache Lucene syntax.

Use ‘projectid:1542-city-of-new-orleans-contracts’ to restrict search to our project.

Parameters:data (dict) – The query parameters.
Returns:string. The query string ready for the DocumentCloud API.
class contracts.models.QueryBuilder¶

Build a query for the DocumentCloud API.

add_term(term, value)¶

Add a term to the dictionary. If term is updated it will just re-write the dictionary value.

add_text(text)¶

Add a freetext component to the query (ex. ‘playground’).

get_query()¶

Translate the dictionary into a DocumentCloud query.

The web app that runs at vault.thelensnola.org/contracts.
